H0.text: Both are forces that can cause rock to break apart, as tree roots grow into rock and water freezes in its cracks.

H1.text: Both affect weather by causing rock to break apart.

H2.text: Both tree roots growing into rock and water freezing in rock cracks form new kinds of rock.

H3.text: Both are forms of weathering, as tree roots grow into rock and break it apart, and water freezes in cracks of rock, causing it to break apart.

A5.text: frost weathering is the most important form of physical weathering

A6.text: Frost weathering is a collective term for several mechanical weathering processes

A7.text: The ice crystal growth weakens the rocks which, in time, break up
